alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:23PM EDT until July 18 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL LEWIS...SOUTHEASTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHWESTERN SCIOTO COUNTIES... At 523 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Vanceburg to near Camp Dix, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Vanceburg, Camp Dix, Rome, Sandy Springs, Garrison, Buena Vista in Scioto County, Saint Paul, Carrs, Rexton, Tannery, Turkey Creek Lake and Friendship. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
